Functions.html#/c:@F@TGLocationCoordinat.name: TGLocationCoordinateDistanceFromCoordinate
Functions.html#/c:@F@TGLocationCoordinat.abstract: Finds the distance (as the crow flies) between two CLLocationCoordinate2ds.

Type Definitions.html#/c:TGRouteRequest..name: TGRouteRequestType
Type Definitions.html#/c:TGRouteRequest..abstract: The request type defines the time parameter as either the desired arrival time or the departure time.

Type Definitions.html#/c:TGStreet.h@T@TG.name: TGStreetFunction
Type Definitions.html#/c:TGStreet.h@T@TG.abstract: The type of this street, such as highway or residential.

Type Definitions.html#/c:TGTurn.h@T@TGTu.name: TGTurnDirection
Type Definitions.html#/c:TGTurn.h@T@TGTu.abstract: The direction of travel at this turn.

Protocols/TGTurnByTurnConfigurable.html#.name: +createWithConfiguration:
Protocols/TGTurnByTurnConfigurable.html#.abstract: Create a new instance of the view controller with a given TGTurnByTurnConfiguration

Protocols/TGTurnByTurnConfigurable.html#.name: -configuration
Protocols/TGTurnByTurnConfigurable.html#.abstract: The TGTurnByTurnConfiguration that was used to create the view controller. Do not attempt to modify any properties after creation.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -coordinateForRequestType:
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: A coordinate to be provided when making a search or suggest request. This helps provide better search results.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -searchExtentForRequestType:
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: A search extent to be provided when making a search or suggest request. This helps provide better search results.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -didSelectSearchResult:
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Handle the search result that the user selected. This could be a selection the user picked from the list of suggestions, or the list of search results.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -searchFieldDidBeginEditing
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override this function to be notified when the user begin interacting with the search text field. The default implementation does nothing.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -shouldShowSearchResults:selectedSearchCategory:
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: When the user performs a search that has multiple results, the view controller calls this delegate method in order to ask whether to show its own results UI.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -shouldShowSearchCancelButton
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Whether or not to show a cancel button after the user selects a search result. If not implemented, NO is assumed.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: -didPressSearchCancelButton
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override this function to be notified when the user presses the cancel button. The default implementation does nothing.

Protocols.html#/c:objc(pl)TGSearchResult.name: TGSearchResultsViewControllerDelegate
Protocols.html#/c:objc(pl)TGSearchResult.abstract: Implement this protocol to be notified of user search results activity.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: TGSearchViewControllerDelegate
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Implement this protocol to be notified of user search activity and to provide locations and search extents for effective searching.

Protocols/TGTurnByTurnConfigurable.html.name: TGTurnByTurnConfigurable
Protocols/TGTurnByTurnConfigurable.html.abstract: Protocol for view controllers that can use a TGTurnByTurnConfiguration

Constants.html#/c:@TGRouteRequestTypeArr.name: TGRouteRequestTypeArrivalTime
Constants.html#/c:@TGRouteRequestTypeArr.abstract: The time specified is the desired arrival time.

Constants.html#/c:@TGRouteRequestTypeDep.name: TGRouteRequestTypeDepartureTime
Constants.html#/c:@TGRouteRequestTypeDep.abstract: The time specified is the desired departure time.

Constants.html#/c:@TGStreetConnectionOff.name: TGStreetConnectionOfframp
Constants.html#/c:@TGStreetConnectionOff.abstract: An unnamed road connecting a highway to a non-highway.

Constants.html#/c:@TGStreetConnectionOnr.name: TGStreetConnectionOnramp
Constants.html#/c:@TGStreetConnectionOnr.abstract: An unnamed road connecting a non-highway to a highway.

Constants.html#/c:@TGStreetConnectionCon.name: TGStreetConnectionConnector
Constants.html#/c:@TGStreetConnectionCon.abstract: A brief, unnamed section of road between two residential streets.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryCurrentPoi.name: TGTelemetryCurrentPointChangeNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryCurrentPoi.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user passes a point on a segment. The userInfo dictionary will contain values for the keys TGTelemetryUserInfoFromPointIndex and TGTelemetryUserInfoToPointIndex.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryNextTurnCh.name: TGTelemetryNextTurnChangeNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryNextTurnCh.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user passes a turn. The userInfo dictionary will contain a value for the key TGTelemetryUserInfoTurnPointIndex.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryProceeding.name: TGTelemetryProceedingToRouteNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryProceeding.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user is instructed to proceed to route.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryStartedNot.name: TGTelemetryStartedNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryStartedNot.abstract: A notification that is posted when user telemetry is started.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryOffRouteNo.name: TGTelemetryOffRouteNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryOffRouteNo.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user is determined to be off the route.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryReroutingN.name: TGTelemetryReroutingNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryReroutingN.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user is being rerouted.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryReroutedNo.name: TGTelemetryReroutedNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryReroutedNo.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user has been rerouted.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryCancelledN.name: TGTelemetryCancelledNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryCancelledN.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user cancels the route.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryConcludedN.name: TGTelemetryConcludedNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryConcludedN.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user concludes the route.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryInitialize.name: TGTelemetryInitializedNotification
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryInitialize.abstract: A notification that is posted when user telemetry is initiated, but not yet started.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoFr.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoFromPointIndex
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoFr.abstract: A userInfo key for the point change notifications and represents the index of the point that was just passed.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoFr.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoFromPoint
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoFr.abstract: A userInfo key for the point change notifications and represents the point that was just passed.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTo.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoToPointIndex
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTo.abstract: A userInfo key for the point change notifications and represents the index of the upcoming point.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTo.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoToPoint
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTo.abstract: A userInfo key for the point change notifications and represents the upcoming point.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTu.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoTurnPointIndex
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTu.abstract: A userInfo key for the turn change notifications and represents the index of the point of the upcoming turn.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTu.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoTurnPoint
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoTu.abstract: A userInfo key for the turn change notifications and represents the point of the upcoming turn.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoET.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoETA
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoET.abstract: A userInfo key for the turn change notifications and represents the driver’s ETA at their destination.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoRo.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoRouteSegment
Constants.html#/c:@TGTelemetryUserInfoRo.abstract: A userInfo key for the turn change notifications and represents the driver’s route segment.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionForwar.name: TGTurnDirectionForward
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionForwar.abstract: No more than 8 degrees to the right or left.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionExitLe.name: TGTurnDirectionExitLeft
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionExitLe.abstract: A highway off-ramp or interchange that is to the left of the carriageway.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionExitRi.name: TGTurnDirectionExitRight
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionExitRi.abstract: A highway off-ramp or interchange that is to the right of the carriageway.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionLeftAt.name: TGTurnDirectionLeftAtTheFork
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionLeftAt.abstract: Two streets are within a forwardmost 60 degree arc. Take the leftmost street.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionRightA.name: TGTurnDirectionRightAtTheFork
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionRightA.abstract: Two streets are within a forwardmost 60 degree arc. Take the rightmost street.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionUTurn.name: TGTurnDirectionUTurn
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionUTurn.abstract: Turn 180 degrees to return the way you came (on the other side of a dual carriageway).

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionUTurnL.name: TGTurnDirectionUTurnLeft
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionUTurnL.abstract: Turn 180 degrees to return the way you came (on the other side of a dual carriageway).

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionUTurnR.name: TGTurnDirectionUTurnRight
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionUTurnR.abstract: Turn 180 degrees to the right to return the way you came (on the other side of a dual carriageway).

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionMergeL.name: TGTurnDirectionMergeLeft
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionMergeL.abstract: A merge into traffic to the left.

Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionMergeR.name: TGTurnDirectionMergeRight
Constants.html#/c:@TGTurnDirectionMergeR.abstract: A merge into traffic on the right.

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: showsTraffic
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Show colored traffic lines as an overlay on the map

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: currentLocation
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: The most recent location reported by the location manager

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: simulatedCoordinate
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Sets the starting location for the driving simulator. Set to nil to disable simulated locations.

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: simulatedHighwaySpeed
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Sets the simulated driving speed on highways

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: simulatedCitySpeed
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Sets the simulated driving speed on city streets

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: +initializeWithAccessToken:
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Asynchronously initializes the TallyGoKit framework with your access token.

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: +initializeWithAccessToken:configurationName:
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Asynchronously initializes the TallyGoKit framework with your access token.

Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.name: +initializeWithAccessToken:configurationName:simulatedCoordinate:
Classes/TallyGo.html#/c:objc(cs)TallyGo(.abstract: Asynchronously initializes the TallyGoKit framework with your access token.

Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.name: address
Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.abstract: An address that represents this waypoint, if known. Must be supplied during initialization, and cannot be changed after.

Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.name: addressDescription
Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.abstract: A textual description that represents this waypoint. May be a string representation of the street address, or any other custom description that would be meaningful to the user. Must be supplied during initialization, and cannot be changed after.

Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.name: -initWithCoordinate:
Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.abstract: Initialize with only a coordinate. The address and a description will be loaded asynchronously, if possible.

Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.name: -initWithCoordinate:address:description:
Classes/TGWaypoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGWay.abstract: Initialize with a coordinate, while specifying an address and description for display in the UI.

Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html#/c:objc(cs.name: enabled
Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Allows the voice service to be turned on/off globally.

Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html#/c:objc(cs.name: -say:
Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Speaks the requested voice prompt using the current voice. If the audio is already cached, it will be used, otherwise it will be downloaded.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: destination
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: The requested destination. If this is changed while en route, a reroute will be triggered.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: commencementSpeech
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Text that will be spoken as view is displayed

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: proceedToRouteSpeech
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Text that will be spoken when the user needs to proceed to the route

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: arrivalSpeech
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Text that will be spoken upon arrival

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: arrivalNotificationMessage
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Text used in local notification if app is in background

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: voice
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: The voice that should be used for voice prompts during the route.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: destinationAddressShort
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Address to be displayed in the route progress bar

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: originDescription
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Address to be displayed on the turn list

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: destinationDescription
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Address to be displayed in the arrival overlay under the address, and on the turn list

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: performAdditionalLayout
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Override point to perform additional layout tasks. Default implementation does nothing.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.name: performActionOnArrival
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html#.abstract: Override point to perform tasks at arrival. Default implementation does nothing.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: destination
Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.abstract: The requested destination. If this is changed while en route, a reroute will be triggered.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: commencementSpeech
Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.abstract: Text that will be spoken as view is displayed

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: proceedToRouteSpeech

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: arrivalNotificationMessage
Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.abstract: Text used in local notification if app is in background

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: voice
Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.abstract: The voice that should be used for voice prompts during the route.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: showMakeWrongTurnButton
Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.abstract: Do not use. For internal testing only.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: destinationAddressShort

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: originDescription

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html#/.name: destinationDescription

Classes/TGTurn.html#/c:objc(cs)TGTurn(py.name: direction
Classes/TGTurn.html#/c:objc(cs)TGTurn(py.abstract: The direction of turn (or destination, when applicable).

Classes/TGTurn.html#/c:objc(cs)TGTurn(py.name: instruction
Classes/TGTurn.html#/c:objc(cs)TGTurn(py.abstract: The text describing the turn instruction for the turn-by-turn list.

Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.name: providerUrl
Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.abstract: URL to a profile on the provider’s website.

Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.name: text
Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.abstract: Text of the suggestion. Contains place name and/or full address.

Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.name: suggestionKey
Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.abstract: Value to be retained and passed into search.

Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.name: price
Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/c:objc(cs)TGS.abstract: An object containing the price tier from 1 (least pricey) - 4 (most pricey) and a message describing the price tier.

Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/c:objc(cs.name: text
Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: The input text entered by a user which is used by the suggest operation to generate a list of possible matches.

Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/c:objc(cs.name: searchExtent
Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Optional. Default value is approximated LA city area. Bounding rectangle to search within. No candidates outside of the rectangle are returned.

Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/c:objc(cs.name: -initWithText:location:searchExtent:
Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Create a suggest request with the required and optional parameters.

Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).name: postal
Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Contains the first 5 digits of the U.S. Zip Code

Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).name: locationName
Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The type of address found. Contents varies.

Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).name: placeName
Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The name of place found. Contents varies.

Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).name: address
Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The street address portion of the result.

Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).name: postalExtension
Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The last 4 digits of a 9-digit U.S. Zip Code.

Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).name: subregion
Classes/TGStreetAddress.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: The subregion. Not normally used for U.S. locations.

Classes/TGStreet.html#/c:objc(cs)TGStree.name: highway
Classes/TGStreet.html#/c:objc(cs)TGStree.abstract: More information about this street if it is a highway.

Classes/TGSearchViewController.html#/c:o.name: delegate
Classes/TGSearchViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: The delegate for receiving user search activity.

Classes/TGSearchViewController.html#/c:o.name: -showCancelButton
Classes/TGSearchViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Use this function to force the cancel button to display. This is useful, for example, if your app has other means to select a location.

Classes/TGSearchViewController.html#/c:o.name: -reset
Classes/TGSearchViewController.html#/c:o.abstract: Use this function to notify the search view controller to reset, for example, after completing or cancelling a route.

Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: location
Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The point found for the closest address.

Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: providerUrl
Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: URL to a profile on the provider’s website.

Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: address
Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The name of the point of interest or address.

Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: matchAddress
Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The place name or partial address string.

Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: addressType
Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The type of address returned, e.g. POI.

Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: -toAddressObject
Classes/TGSearchResult.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Get a TGAddress object from search result. Only location name, match address, and address may be populated.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).name: singleLine
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Specifies the location to be geocoded. This can be a street address, place name, postal code, or point of interest.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).name: location
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Defines an origin point location to improve the search results.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).name: searchExtent
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Default value is approximated LA city area. Bounding rectangle to search within. No results outside of the rectangle are returned.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).name: suggestionKey
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Value obtained from prior request to suggest API, used to get the location of a specific suggestion.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -initWithSingleLine:location:searchExtent:suggestionKey:
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Create a find address request with the required and optional parameters.

Classes/TGSearchExtent.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: -string
Classes/TGSearchExtent.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: A comma separated string of longitude and latitude.

Classes/TGRouteSegment.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: points
Classes/TGRouteSegment.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Every point in the route in sequence.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: waypoints
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Array of waypoints. Alternative way of providing coordinates.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: requestType
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The type of request, either arrival or departure time request.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: speed
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The current speed of the user. This is used by the routing engine to prevent situations where the driver is told to turn sooner than would be possible at the start of their route.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: course
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: The current course of the user. This is used by the routing engine to determine the starting direction of the route.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: existingTripId
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Optional. For reroutes you may pass in an existing Trip ID to be used on the first returned segment.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: -initWithCoords:
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Create a route request with the required and optional parameters.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: -initWithCoords:time:requestType:speed:course:existingTripId:
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Create a route request with the required and optional parameters.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: -initWithWaypoints:
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Create a route request with waypoints (which allow you to specify textual descriptions in the UI)

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: -initWithWaypoints:time:requestType:speed:course:existingTripId:
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Create a route request with waypoints (which allow you to specify textual descriptions in the UI) along with optional parameters

Classes/TGRoute.html#/c:objc(cs)TGRoute(.name: totalDistance
Classes/TGRoute.html#/c:objc(cs)TGRoute(.abstract: The total travel distance across all segments, represented in meters.

Classes/TGRoute.html#/c:objc(cs)TGRoute(.name: totalDuration
Classes/TGRoute.html#/c:objc(cs)TGRoute(.abstract: Estimated driven travel time across all segments, in seconds.

Classes/TGRoute.html#/c:objc(cs)TGRoute(.name: tripId
Classes/TGRoute.html#/c:objc(cs)TGRoute(.abstract: A unique ID representing a sequence of segments from different rerouting event.

Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html#/c.name: location
Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html#/c.abstract: The point found for the closest address.

Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html#/c.name: address
Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html#/c.abstract: The address object containing detailed location information.

Classes/TGReverseGeocodeRequest.html#/c:.name: location
Classes/TGReverseGeocodeRequest.html#/c:.abstract: Defines the point location to be reverse geocoded.

Classes/TGReverseGeocodeRequest.html#/c:.name: -initWithLocation:
Classes/TGReverseGeocodeRequest.html#/c:.abstract: Create a reverse geocode request with the required location parameters.

Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.name: notify
Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.abstract: The out-of-app notification to be displayed at or near this point.

Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.name: travelTime
Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.abstract: Estimated travel time in seconds from the previous point.

Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.name: distance
Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.abstract: The distance in meters from the previous point.

Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.name: coordinate
Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.abstract: The coordinate of the point being represented.

Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.name: say
Classes/TGPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)TGPoint(.abstract: The instructions to be spoken at or near this point.

Classes/TGNavigationService.html#/c:objc.name: +routeForRequest:completionHandler:
Classes/TGNavigationService.html#/c:objc.abstract: Find the fastest route given multiple waypoints, a time, and a search type describing whether the time is a departure or arrival time.

Classes/TGNavigationService.html#/c:objc.name: +boundaryForRequest:completionHandler:
Classes/TGNavigationService.html#/c:objc.abstract: Returns the boundary of the supported navigation area. The navigation API is unable to handle routes outside of these bounds.

Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.name: menuButton
Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.abstract: A ‘hambuger’ style menu button. By default, it does nothing when tapped, but you can implement a handler with didSelectMenuButton. You can hide this

Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.name: compassButton
Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.abstract: A button that toggles the compass mode of the map (whether up is north, or whether up is the direction the user is facing). You can hide this button if

Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.name: showTallyGoLogo
Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.abstract: Whether to show the TallyGo logo at the bottom of the map view.

Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.name: onSelectMenuButton
Classes/TGMapViewController.html#/c:objc.abstract: This block is executed when the user taps the hamburger button. You should present a menu of some kind, perhaps with an option to exit the map and return

Classes/TGMapStyle.html#/c:objc(cs)TGMap.name: normalURL
Classes/TGMapStyle.html#/c:objc(cs)TGMap.abstract: URL for map style without traffic overlay.

Classes/TGMapStyle.html#/c:objc(cs)TGMap.name: trafficURL
Classes/TGMapStyle.html#/c:objc(cs)TGMap.abstract: URL for map style with traffic overlay.

Classes/TGIdleTimer.html#/c:objc(cs)TGId.name: -disableIdleTimer
Classes/TGIdleTimer.html#/c:objc(cs)TGId.abstract: Disables the idle timer and prevents the device from sleeping.

Classes/TGIdleTimer.html#/c:objc(cs)TGId.name: -enableIdleTimerAfterTimeInterval:
Classes/TGIdleTimer.html#/c:objc(cs)TGId.abstract: Enables the idle timer and allows the device to sleep, but only after the given delay.

Classes/TGGeoJSONObject.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -containsCoordinate:
Classes/TGGeoJSONObject.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: A method to determine if a GeoJSON object contains a given coordinate. Use this to test your origin and destination locations before attempting to generate a route.

Classes/TGGeoJSONFeature.html#/c:objc(cs.name: geometry
Classes/TGGeoJSONFeature.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Describes the shape of the GeoJSON object.

Classes/TGFindService.html#/c:objc(cs)TG.name: +searchWithRequest:completionHandler:
Classes/TGFindService.html#/c:objc(cs)TG.abstract: Find locations based on various search criteria.

Classes/TGFindService.html#/c:objc(cs)TG.name: +reverseGeocodeWithRequest:completionHandler:
Classes/TGFindService.html#/c:objc(cs)TG.abstract: Attempts to find a fully-qualified street address for given a location coordinate.

Classes/TGEventService.html#/c:objc(cs)T.name: +getWithRequest:completionHandler:
Classes/TGEventService.html#/c:objc(cs)T.abstract: Retrieves a list of current accidents and hazards for the supported service area.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)TGBoundaryReques.name: TGBoundaryRequest
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)TGBoundaryReques.abstract: A request to get the area coverered by the navigation service.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)TGBoundaryRespon.name: TGBoundaryResponse
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)TGBoundaryRespon.abstract: The response that contains the boundary of the covered navigational area.

Classes/TGEventService.html.name: TGEventService
Classes/TGEventService.html.abstract: Provides an interface to TallyGo’s events API providing accident and road hazard information.

Classes/TGFindService.html.name: TGFindService
Classes/TGFindService.html.abstract: Provides access to the TallyGo Find service for street address and point-of-interest searching, as well as reverse geocoding.

Classes/TGGeoJSONPoint.html.name: TGGeoJSONPoint
Classes/TGGeoJSONPoint.html.abstract: A GeoJSON object that represents a single point.

Classes/TGIdleTimer.html.name: TGIdleTimer
Classes/TGIdleTimer.html.abstract: A class that facilitiates disabling the device’s idle timer.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)TGMapView.name: TGMapView
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)TGMapView.abstract: A subclass of MGLMapView that uses the TallyGo map style and updates traffic lines.

Classes/TGMapViewController.html.name: TGMapViewController
Classes/TGMapViewController.html.abstract: A view controller that shows a map, complete with search bar, compass toggle button, and hamburger menu button (the latter of which can be customized).

Classes/TGNavigationService.html.name: TGNavigationService
Classes/TGNavigationService.html.abstract: Provides an interface to TallyGo’s navigation API.

Classes/TGPoint.html.name: TGPoint
Classes/TGPoint.html.abstract: TGPoint represents a specific location along the route, and may also contain data important at that location.

Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html.name: TGReverseGeocodeResponse
Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html.abstract: Response object from the reverse geocode function.

Classes/TGRoute.html.name: TGRoute
Classes/TGRoute.html.abstract: TGRoute represents a drivable route between points in the road network. A route consists of one or more segments, which in turn consist of a collection of points on the road network.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html.name: TGRouteRequest
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html.abstract: Request for turn by turn navigation with multiple waypoints.

Classes/TGRouteSegment.html.name: TGRouteSegment
Classes/TGRouteSegment.html.abstract: TGRouteSegment represets one segment of a route. A route from location A to B will consist of only one segment. Introducing a stop along the way will result in two segments, from A to B, and B to C. Similar to routes, each segment has its own distance, and estimated travel time.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html.name: TGSearchRequest
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html.abstract: Defines parameters for a location search performed with TGFind.search()

Classes/TGSearchViewController.html.name: TGSearchViewController
Classes/TGSearchViewController.html.abstract: View controller that allows the user to find locations by entering text searches.

Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html.name: TGSuggestRequest
Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html.abstract: Request for a list of suggested autocompletion location items.

Classes/TGTurn.html.name: TGTurn
Classes/TGTurn.html.abstract: TGTurn represents a turn at a specific point in the route.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html.name: TGTurnByTurnConfiguration
Classes/TGTurnByTurnConfiguration.html.abstract: Contains configuration settings that can be used by the various view controllers related to turn-by-turn navigation.

Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html.name: TGTurnByTurnViewController
Classes/TGTurnByTurnViewController.html.abstract: View controller with TallyGo navigation and map view

Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html.name: TGVoiceSynthesis
Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html.abstract: Service to speak and preload voice prompts.

Classes/TGWaypoint.html.name: TGWaypoint
Classes/TGWaypoint.html.abstract: Represents a start or end point of a route segment

Type Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
